subject: Re: [junit] Problem with setup()
msgSnippet: ... I notice you typed setup there. It s setUp . If you type it incorrectly, then instead of overriding setUp(), you are creating a method that no-one
messageBody:
Dinesh Kundu wrote:

> when i am writing the test cases them if i initialize
> anything in the setup() method (which is to be used by
> all the methods) then on running the tests it gives me
> NULL POINTER EXCEPTION.

I notice you typed "setup" there. It's "setUp". If you type it
incorrectly, then instead of overriding setUp(), you are creating a
method that no-one invokes.
--
J. B. (Joe) Rainsberger
